text:
- Hi, my name is Sam and
I'm a CPO at Nexthink.
- I'm Vedant Sampath, CTO at Nexthink.
(bright upbeat piano music)
- Today, employees face, you know,

a situation where it's
extremely important for them

to be able to be productive
and to use IT tools.
- When you think of it,
the employee is the critical asset.
I mean, I know it's said a lot,

but that is the secret of
your growth in some ways.
And if you don't give them
the kind of opportunities to shine,

if their computers,
their digital workspaces
don't work for them efficiently,
it impacts you and your business.
- What Nexthink allows to do
is really to change the perspective

of our IT departments are
observing this environment.
If you think about the traditional tools,
they're looking at the data center,
they're looking at the network,
they're looking at the infrastructure.

But those are all side channels,
in terms of observability.

It would like be driving a car
only using your side mirrors,

where you don't see
what is in front of you.

And these IT departments are
still expecting, in some ways,
employees to tell them what doesn't work.

So we use employees as a way
to identify problems, right?
And do something that needs to change.

They need to have an
observability point that matches

what is the experience
for these employees,
and is what Nexthink is providing.

So probably the biggest
benefits about Nexthink
is allowing IT departments
to become a true partner of the business,
going from a provider of solutions
to a real partner
that is able to enable the business
to have better tools, better solutions,

and better productivity
for those employees.
Today we have over 1000 enterprise
and large enterprise customers worldwide.

And these numbers growing
really, really quickly.
So, we really managed to grow
and reach this famous unicorn step, right?
(upbeat music)
Nexthink was born 18 years ago.
So at the time,

we were talking about
on-premise software, right?
And our first step in the journey
was to move to Cloud solution
and now to Cloud Native solution with AWS.
So this has been instrumental,
in order to be able to speed up innovation

and to be able to target new
markets much more quickly.
- So ours has been,

the migration started
from on-prem to the Cloud,
and then there was a choice that was made

on the type of Cloud
platform that we would use.

Once we made the decision
on what we needed to do
to build a next generation platform,

the Cloud Native platform
that we were building,
we had to analyze what were the components

that would make it really
easy for us to do that?
For us to be able to,
to deal with this fire hose of data
that comes from all of the endpoints?
So for us, the choice was,
who has the best managed Kafka?

Who has the best managed
services that we needed?

Kubernetes, Aurora, I mean
the databases that we need.

And for us, AWS really stood
out from that standpoint.

AWS is completely
integrated into our offering
and every new capability,
at any managed service that we have,

we're using the managed API
platform as well, for example.

So our ability to develop
something this quickly
would've been a lot harder

if we didn't have the AWS
Cloud infrastructure available,

and as well as the help from
all of the solution architects

and the professional
services from AWS available.

- So I work with different
teams at Nexthink
and every time my goal
is to make sure that they can deliver
the best version of data application.
And this can take different forms.
It can be architecture reviews,
it can be presentation,
it can be some brainstorming session
with different teams at Nexthink,

developers, product teams,
architecture teams, and so on.

- The thing I like about
our AWS partnership

is that the team that
we've been working with,

the account team that I work
with and my team works with,
they're really focused on ensuring

that we have the most effective
and cost efficient platform
that we can get.
- Nexthink was born as a Swiss company,
but now we're everywhere.

And the Cloud plays a
huge importance to that
because it allows us to seamlessly
be anywhere in the planet.
So this is something that,
across the industry,
believe it's been a huge revolution.
- And our whole platform is based on AWS
so we wouldn't be where we are
without that infrastructure in place.
So AWS is critical for what we do.
(bright upbeat piano music)
